wikipedia_page.main: Reginald ('Rex') Salisbury Woods MD, FRCS, (15 October 1891 – 21 September 1986) was a British track and field athlete, who represented Great Britain in three Olympic Games.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1924 Summer Olympics

response: Bevan was doctor to the philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein whilst he was in Cambridge. After Bevan diagnosed Wittgenstein with prostate cancer, Wittgenstein moved in with Bevan in Storey's Way, Cambridge in February 1951, where he stayed until his death on 29 April 1951.Ludwig Wittgenstein: the final years  In Cambridge Bevan shared a medical practice with Rex Woods, the Olympic shot putter.
